alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Kanawha; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 7:28PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms and heavy rain will impact portions of northeastern Kanawha, western Roane and southeastern Jackson Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 725 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms 8 miles northeast of Sissonville, or 16 miles northeast of Charleston, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph,pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ripley, Spencer, Sissonville, Clendenin, Pinch, Kenna, Elkview, Statts Mills, Harmony, Kentuck, Walton, Fairplain, Gay and Gandeeville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 3 and 21. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 117 and 133, and near mile marker 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
